title: BBC Local Live: Coventry and Warwickshire - BBC News
summary: coventry role in brum 's 2022 games bid .
judge seeks report on gun boy .

documents.title: two tons , 29 sixes & 443 runs in chelmsford thriller
text: two tons , 29 sixes & 443 runs in chelmsford thriller
author: Gary Smee
BBC Sport

documents.title: denly & mckay shine , roses rivals tie
text: denly & mckay shine , roses rivals tie
author: Brendon Mitchell
BBC Sport

documents.title: race on to be uk 's next city of culture
text: race on to be uk 's next city of culture

documents.title: our coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 on monday .

documents.title: school farm animals to be rehomed
text: pupils at cardinal wiseman school in coventry have been caring for animals on the site for almost 20 years .
the school has announced the farm will close and will stop offering agricultural studies as a subject to pupils .
it is working with animal sanctuaries to rehome the livestock and said pupils would be given the opportunity to adopt the farm 's smaller animals including rabbits , mice and hamsters .

documents.title: watch : your 50-second weather forecast
text: after a bright and dry evening with sunny spells , the region will tend to cloud over during the night .
low cloud , rain and drizzle will reach the region by morning .
lows of 14c ( 57f ) .
author: Rebecca Wood
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: new bed for newborn babies coming to warwickshire hospitals
text: more than 100 new and expectant mums are expected to be at the launch of a new bed for newborn babies to be used in hospitals across warwickshire - the baby box .
author: Warwick Courier

documents.title: rugby homes plan submitted
text: the plan to deliver 12,400 homes by 2031 in rugby has been submitted to the government , the council says .
an inspector will now be appointed to carry out an independent examination of the plan , expected to be adopted by the council in the spring of 2018 .
the plan also sets out 110 hectares of `` employment land '' and more than 8,000 square meters of retail space .
cllr heather timms said the submission was a `` significant step towards delivering planned , sustainable growth with the supporting schools , roads and other infrastructure that we need '' .

documents.title: video : school closes farm run by pupils
text: a school in coventry is set to close a farm on its site that has seen pupils caring for animals for nearly 20 years .
cardinal wiseman catholic school said there had been a decline in those opting to study agricultural subjects .
it said it was working with wildlife sanctuaries to find a home for livestock .
author: Tom Cooke
BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: m40 re-opens after vehicle overturns
text: all lanes have reopened on the m40 northbound between j16 for a3400 and m42 j3a after a vehicle oveturned .
highways england says there are still long delays in the area .
overturned vehicle has been recovered and all lanes now open # m40 n/b btwn j16 + # m42 j3a .
long delays back to j15 , approach with care .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: bus diversion for leamington carnival
text: buses in leamington spa will be diverted away from the parade between 12:00 and 15:00 on saturday due to the town 's carnival parade .
temporary bus stations will be used .
# leamington leamington parade closure on 15th july between 1200 & 1500 - click for more

documents.title: man who died in m45 crash named
text: a man who died in a crash on the m45 at dunchurch last week has been named by police as 55-year-old mark folwell from northampton .
the single-vehicle crash happened on thursday 6 july on the eastbound carriageway at about 04:30 .
peter 's family said he would be `` truly missed by each and every person that was lucky enough to have known him '' .

documents.title: your warwickshire wildlife
text: our weather watcher rons view snapped these gorgeous of wildlife in coleshill .
you can find out more about becoming a bbc weather watcher and how to upload your photographs here .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: judge seeks psychiatric report on boy who took loaded gun to school
text: a judge has ordered a psychiatric report on a teenager who took a loaded shotgun to a school .
the 15 year old admitted taking 200 rounds of ammunition , a lock-knife and mask into the warwickshire site last month .
a previous hearing at leamington spa youth court , at which the boy entered guilty pleas , was told he phoned 999 following `` a change of heart '' about harming others .
the teenager is due to be sentenced on september 8 .

documents.title: ready , set , go ! coventry is getting an indoor go-karting track
text: an indoor go-karting track is coming to coventry after councillors gave the green light to develop a former factory .
author: Coventry Telegraph

documents.title: coventry city 's owner in new legal row with council
text: fresh legal proceedings are under way as the dispute over the sale of the ricoh arena continues between coventry city fc 's owner and the city council .
it is the second time sisu has taken the council to court .
a judicial review previously found for the authority .
the row concerns the council 's sale of its 50 % share in the arena to wasps rugby club in 2014 .

documents.title: 'hippy crack ' drug canisters littering nuneaton industrial estate
text: dozens of laughing gas canisters have been found discarded on a nuneaton industrial estate .
author: Coventry Telegraph

documents.title: three taken to hospital after lythalls lane crash
text: three people have been taken to hospital after a car crashed into a tree and overturned in coventry this morning .
the ambulance service said two other people in the car were unhurt in the incident on lythalls lane at about 08:00 .
author: Vanessa Pearce
BBC Local Live

documents.title: award for speaking up for rights of blind people
text: on the front page this week : a kenilworth couple who both went blind as children will receive an honorary degree from the university of warwick for their services to visually impaired people .
author: Kenilworth Weekly News

documents.title: is this warwickshire 's oldest paperboy ?
text: a 77 year old who 's shunned retirement says his job delivering papers keeps him fit enough to help raise money for charity .
john insoll , who 's been delivering the stratford observer around shottery for more than ten years , is about to take on a second round .
he said the exercise helped him recently complete a 5k run .

documents.title: school announces closure of farm
text: school announces closure of farm

documents.title: nadhim zahawi welcomes inquiry into contaminated blood scandal
text: an inquiry into the `` worst treatment disaster in the history of the nhs '' which affected several stratford residents has been welcomed by nadhim zahawi .
author: Stratford Observer

documents.title: five-vehicle crash on m6
text: despite five vehicles being damaged on the m6 this morning , no-one was injured , police say .
the crash happened between corley services and junction 4 of the m42 .
damage only to 5 vehicles on m6 .
luckily no injury .
rg
very lucky no injuries

documents.title: coventry city owners sisu , wasps and council in court today over ricoh arena sale
text: lawyers for coventry city owners sisu and coventry city council will go head-to-head at birmingham high court today .
author: Coventry Telegraph

documents.title: coventry to benefit from 2022 games bid
text: three new venues have been revealed for birmingham 's commonwealth games bid including coventry 's ricoh arena .
and the home of wasps would be used for netball , should birmingham become host city .
as part of the bid , the planned sandwell aquatics centre would be upgraded to include warm-up and competition diving pools , while villa park would host the rugby sevens tournament .

documents.title: five-vehicle crash causing m6 tailbacks
text: five vehicles are involved in the crash on the m6 northbound , police say .
all lanes have re-opened but there is queuing traffic in the area .
opu dealing with 5 vehicle collison in m6 corley to junction 3a .
road is clear but delays are expected .
rg
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: video : what 's the weather got in store today ?
text: after a cloudy start with the chance of some drizzle , it should brighten up this afternoon with some sunny spells in store .
it will feel quite warm in the sunshine this afternoon , with top temperatures of 20c ( 68f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: live updates for coventry and warwickshire
text: good morning from the coventry and warwickshire live team .
we 'll be bringing you all the latest news , sport , travel and weather for coventry and warwickshire between now and 18:00 .
if you 'd like to get in touch with the bbc local live team , you can do so by emailing us , tweeting @ twitterid or visiting our facebook page .
author: Vanessa Pearce
BBC Local Live

documents.title: our service across the day
text: live updates have now finished for coventry and warwickshire .
we 'll be back with you from 08:00 tomorrow with the usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather .

documents.title: new ambulance response programme to be rolled-out
text: a new way of prioritising ambulance calls which officials say will save more lives is to be rolled out across england , the government has announced .
under the ambulance response programme ( arp ) 999 call handlers ask extra questions to work out whether it 's best to respond straight away .
west midlands ambulance service , one of three regions to pilot the scheme , says the time it took for them to arrive at a patient was quicker on average by up to a minute .

documents.title: no more direct flights to america from birmingham
text: united airlines has announced its stopping direct flights to new york from birmingham airport .
in a statement , the company said the decision to pull out was `` regretful '' and blamed the route 's poor financial performance .
it means birmingham now has no direct flights to the states , except a weekly service largely for holidaymakers to orlando in florida .
author: BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: stolen jack russell millie dumped from jacked truck finds her way home
text: a jack russell unsuspectingly stolen by car jackers has been re-united with her owner .
millie was in a red mitsubishi truck when thieves struck at a farm in hunningham near leamington this afternoon - jumping in it as soon as her owner pulled up in the yard and speeding off .
author: Leamington Observer

documents.title: electric railway museum to close
text: a museum housing a collection of electric trains could close later this year .
the site of the electric railway museum , next to coventry airport , is set to become part of jaguar land rover 's whitley expansion scheme .
landowners coventry city council have not renewed the museum 's lease and trustees of the attraction say despite efforts an alternative location for the attraction has not been found .
the closure announcement is not a done deal '' , the trustees added , but unless an urgent solution is found the museum will open to the public for the final time on sunday , 8 october .
they said it 's devastating '' to think that the west midlands could potentially lose this unique cultural asset '' .

documents.title: weather for tonight and tomorrow
text: after a largely dry and bright evening , there may be some showers at times overnight .
however , many places will stay dry and mild with some clear spells - lows of 15c ( 59f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: your allotment poppy
text: today 's weather is from dave atkinson who took this stunning image of a poppy in the rain on a leamington spa allotment .
you can get in touch with your by emailing us , tweeting @ twitterid or visiting our facebook page .
author: Shefali Oza
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: biker left lying in road after crash at notorious blackspot
text: a motorcyclist was left lying in the middle of the road '' after a nasty accident at a notorious junction in north warwickshire this morning .
author: Coventry Telegraph

documents.title: rail disruption until end of service
text: a fault with the signalling system between kings langley and milton keynes central has now been resolved , the national rail website says .
although lines have now reopened , major disruption is expected to be in place between london euston and rugby .
trains may be delayed by up to 60 minutes , cancelled or revised .
disruption is expected to continue until the end of service .

documents.title: suspected drug dealer caught after trying to out-run bike-riding cops in nuneaton
text: a suspected dealer tried to out run cops on motorbikes through a nuneaton estate - but was quickly caught with £ 800 worth of drugs .
author: Nuneaton News

documents.title: electric railway museum 'could shut '
text: electric railway museum 'could shut '

documents.title: your reflections of hatton
text: this lovely of hatton lock was taken by weather watcher elle nino this morning .
you can learn more about being a weather watcher , and upload your photographs here .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: liverpool competes with west midlands for channel 4 relocation
text: brookside creator phil redmond is leading a rival bid to bring channel 4 to liverpool , saying `` there could be no better home '' .
the west midlands combined authority ( wmca ) launched a bid for the broadcaster to move to its region last week , with sites proposed in coventry , birmingham , solihull and dudley .
a government consultation is considering whether the broadcaster should move out of central london .
elsewhere , two bradford mps have called on channel 4 to move its hq to west yorkshire .

documents.title: death of toddler shaken to death by foster mum 'could have been prevented '
text: a toddler who died after being violently shaken by his foster mother could have been saved if warning signs had been acted on - a serious case review has found .
author: Coventry Telegraph

documents.title: skip lorry death of girl was accident
text: skip lorry death of girl was accident

documents.title: coventry is now one of the uk 's top ten universities for employment rates
text: coventry is now one of the uk 's top ten universities for employment rates - its highest ever placing - according to new government figures .
author: Coventry Observer

documents.title: west midlands house prices on the rise
text: house prices in the west midlands are on the rise despite a national fall .
according to the royal institute of chartered surveyors , net balances for houses here went up by 33 % last month .
across the country house prices fell in june - with the number of properties available also dropping to a new all-time low .
author: Louise Hancock
Newsreader, BBC WM

documents.title: rail disruption expected until 15:00
text: major disruption between london euston and rugby is expected to last until at least 15:00 says national rail .
some passengers at rugby are being diverted via leicester to connect with east midlands trains services .
bus replacement services are also running between rugby and milton keynes via northampton .
# vtnew : due to a fault with the signalling system between watford junction and rugby all lines are blocked
# vtupdate we have ticket acceptance with @ twitterid @ twitterid and @ twitterid via any reasonable route until further notice

author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: open water lessons for children across the midlands
text: hundreds of schoolchildren are getting a taste of open water by outdoor swimming this week , in an effort to keep them safe over the summer holidays .
the swimsafe initiative usually takes place near the coast , but for the first time ever it 's being done in birmingham 's salford park .
it involves pupils from across the midlands , who are being taught the perils of the open water such as cold water shock and currents .
author: Amy Cole
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: inquest finds sophia mcdonald died in road accident
text: the coroner at the inquest into the death of a seven-year-old girl in coventry , who died after being hit by a skip lorry , said her death was as the result of a road collision .
sophia mcdonald was crossing the henley road in the bell green area of the city , in october last year , when she was hit by the slow-moving vehicle .
the hearing at coventry magistrates heard sophia , from bell green , died from a head injury as a result of the collision .
attending the hearing sophia 's mother , yvonne clarke , said she did n't hold anyone responsible apart from herself .
author: Marian McNamee
Reporter, BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: prepare for train cancellations
text: a fault with the signalling system between kings langley and milton keynes central means that journeys between london euston and rugby are being disrupted , the national rail website says .
trains may be delayed by up to 60 minutes , cancelled or revised .
virgin trains and london midland routes are affected .

documents.title: hunt for mystery warwickshire man who helped stranded young family
text: a grateful young mum is trying to track down a warwickshire man who helped her family when their car broke down .
author: Stratford Observer

documents.title: 'prolific beggar ' banned in leamington
text: a man has been banned from begging in leamington spa town centre , the fourth person in the town , say police , to receive a criminal behaviour order against them to stop them asking for money .
the man , police describe as a `` prolific beggar '' , wo n't be allowed to sit on the pavement or in doorways , or put a hat or cup on the ground , to encourage people to give him cash .
he 'll also have to attend appointments with the recovery partnership , a drug and alcohol treatment service .
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: sky blues : robins to make decision on moorhouse
text: sky blues manager mark robins says he will make a decision on the future of greg moorhouse , currently on trial with the club , when the squad returns from their training camp in alicante .
the irish forward has played in both the city 's pre-season matches so far .
he 's worked really hard with the rest of the squad , and he 's put in some decent performances .
there maybe something in the offing , but we 'll make that decision on our return .
warm-ups underway for the # skyblues this morning in alicante # pusb
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire Sport

documents.title: convicted rapist handed more jail time after knifing bouncer
text: a man who is already serving over 14 years in prison for rape and trafficking will be behind bars for even longer - after being convicted of stabbing a nightclub doorman .
author: Coventry Telegraph

documents.title: fire closes nuneaton road
text: part of queens road in nuneaton is closed due to a fire , says the ambulance service .
some bus services are being diverted along manor court road due to the incident .
queens road nuneaton closed due to fire @ twitterid and @ twitterid in attendance use alternative routes @ twitterid
@ twitterid
# nuneaton queens rd closed due to fire .
services 9 and10 diverting along manor court rd until further notice
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: £ 5.7m for electric vehicle producers
text: a £ 5.7m award has been given to warwick manufacturing group to work with jaguar land rover on the science behind electric vehicles .
it 's part of a £ 31m `` prosperity partnership '' scheme to be launched by government minister jo johnson today .
wmg said the funding will help achieve the uk 's vision that by 2050 almost every car and van in the uk will be an ultra-low emission vehicle .
this integrated approach brings the potential for the uk to lead , both industrially and scientifically , in an area of high growth and relevance in the uk 's industrial strategy .

documents.title: worried residents say number of houses planned for council headquarters to treble
text: residents are fighting plans to more than triple the number of new homes built on the site of warwick district council 's headquarters in leamington .
author: Leamington Observer

documents.title: colleges announce merger
text: coventry 's city college and henley college are merging to become coventry college , it 's been announced .
city college was being monitored by ofsted last year after being rated inadequate for the second time in three years .
a joint statement says the change will come about on 1 august , after a public consultation , with the `` majority of respondents supportive of the proposed merger '' .
a new principal has been appointed and the head of henley college , ray goy , has announced his retirement .

documents.title: family fun day to raise funds for permanent tribute to tragic bedworth dad
text: he was loved by so many and his life was taken so tragically that the family of a bedworth dad wanted something positive to come from their loss .
author: Nuneaton News

documents.title: police body camera evidence 'high quality '
text: body-worn video cameras have been used by police in rugby for the first time .
officers say they found footage they 've gathered was `` high quality '' and useful as evidence .
body worn video is now being carried by our staff .
it 's for lawful police purposes to protect you & us and is overtly worn
good - it keeps everything clearer and safer for everyone

documents.title: inquest to open into seven-year-old girl 's death
text: the inquest will take place today into the death of a seven-year-old girl who died after being hit by a skip lorry .
sophia mcdonald was crossing the henley road in the bell green area of coventry when she was struck .
she was confirmed dead at the scene .
her family described her as a `` beautiful angel '' .
the incident took place in october 2016 .

documents.title: video : what 's the weather got in store today ?
text: there will be some showers around this morning before a dry and bright afternoon with top temperatures of 21c ( 70f ) .
you can find a detailed forecast for your area on the bbc weather site .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: good morning from the coventry newsroom
text: good morning from the coventry and warwickshire live team .
we 'll be bringing you all the latest news , sport , travel and weather for coventry and warwickshire between now and 18:00 .
if you 'd like to get in touch with the bbc local live team , you can do so by emailing us , tweeting @ twitterid or visiting our facebook page .
author: Vanessa Pearce
BBC Local Live

documents.title: our coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 tomorrow .
keep an eye out here for more updates and breaking news before then .

documents.title: blind kenilworth couple will receive honorary degree
text: a kenilworth couple who both went blind as children will receive an honorary degree from the university of warwick for their services to visually impaired people .
author: Leamington Courier

documents.title: your photos : rain in oxhill
text: we 've seen some more rain about today and this photo was shared with us by one of the bbc weather watchers in oxhill earlier .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: over 1,000 indecent exposure incidents since 2010
text: over 1,000 reports of indecent exposure have been investigated by police in warwickshire and west mercia since 2010 .
the peak came in 2015 , when there were 61 incidents reported in the warwickshire area and 144 in shropshire , herefordshire and worcestershire .
in total there have been 1,285 reports , 384 of those in warwickshire and there has been no clear trend - upwards or downwards .

documents.title: watch : your 50-second weather
text: it will remain dry overnight with largely clear skies and light winds leading to a cooler night than of late , especially in rural parts - lows of 15c ( 59f ) .
author: Shefali Oza
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: warwickshire 's gunn becomes england 's leading wicket-taker
text: warwickshire 's jenny gunn has just become england 's all-time leading wicket-taker in one-day internationals .
england are closing in on victory over new zealand as they attempt to secure a place in the semi-finals of the women 's world cup .
gunn has taken two key wickets , with new zealand needing 78 runs from five overs .
you can follow all the action online .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: more than 1,000 vacancies at hospital trust
text: there are 1,042 vacancies at the university hospitals coventry & warwickshire nhs trust , a freedom of information ( foi ) request has revealed .
the biggest gaps were in nursing at each one of the 92 trusts who responded to the foi request by itv news .
`` we are rightly saying we want to have much higher standards of care after the tragedy of mid staffs , we can not allow hospitals to skimp on nursing staff .
but you ca n't magic up doctors and nurses , they need to be trained , we 've increased the number of doctors we 're training , we 've made big reforms to nurse training . ''

documents.title: travel : delays on coventry to nuneaton trains
text: rail services between coventry and nuneaton face delays after a problem on one of the trains , london midland says .
the train operator says buses are being brought in to replace some services .
road transport has been requested .
further updates to follow shortly
a lm train or freight
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: concern for missing teen grows two weeks on
text: police in nuneaton say they 're concerned for the welfare of a teenage girl who went missing from the town more than two weeks ago .
britney bailey , 15 , was last seen in greenside close on 26 june .
she was last seen wearing red and white striped t-shirt vest , black leggings , light khaki green bomber jacket and white trainers .

documents.title: travel : water main bursts near warwick
text: there are problems on the birmingham road in hatton park near to warwick , where a water pipe has burst .
severn trent says it burst this morning and that temporary traffic lights are in place while the repairs are completed .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: work to reduce congestion at city roadabout
text: work to reduce congestion at a major junction on the a45 in coventry begins later this month .
an extra lane is to be added to the roundabout by leamington road and st martin 's road , with a couple of crossings for pedestrians added .

documents.title: longer journeys for maternity and children 's a & e after hospital changes approved
text: a re-organisation of worcestershire 's hospitals has been unanimously approved by the county 's health commissioners , meaning people living in south warwickshire will now have to go to worcester for maternity and a & e children 's services .

this morning all three clinical commissioning groups have voted in favour of centralising emergency surgery , maternity and care for severely ill children at the worcestershire royal , and scaling back services at the alexandra hospital in redditch .

documents.title: man suffers injuries to head and face in assault
text: a man has been assaulted in coleshill , leaving him with injuries to his head and face , police say .
it happened on digby road at 15:00 on monday afternoon .
police say a 46-year-old man from the town was arrested on sus of assault and has been released on police bail until next month .

documents.title: councillor wants more powers over tower block safety
text: councils need to be given more powers over building regulations , a coventry city councillor has said .
jim o'boyle 's comments come after the removal of cladding on the former allied carpets building on corporation street in the wake of the grenfell tower fire .

residents in hillman house have been sent letters by the council , saying it believes the newly installed cladding on west orchards house on corporation street is n't appropriate for high rise buildings .
we need far more power in order to make sure all buildings of all types are properly regulated .
at the moment that power does n't exist with local authorities , but we are calling on the government that they do bring it back to us . ''

documents.title: endangered snow leopards born at twycross zoo
text: look at these cute snow leopards
the two female cubs are the latest additions at twycross zoo , the third pair for mum irma and dad suou .
they were born in april but spent time with their mother for a few months in a den to allow them to settle , but they are now venturing around .
they have older siblings , a boy and a girl born in 2011 and two boys born in 2013 .
snow leopards are classified as endangered and are native to the mountains in central and south asia , the zoo said .
the two girls are growing at an incredible rate and their mother irma is doing a fantastic job looking after them .

she has been amazing since day one and i am sure these little girls will grow into strong and healthy females that will help our efforts in maintaining a sustainable population of snow leopards in zoos around the world . ''
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: your blue skies breaking the grey
text: it looks like it 's been a bit of a dull start to wednesday across coventry and warwickshire .
the blue skies are trying to push through , certainly in coleshill as captured by bbc weather watcher rons view .
the same ca n't quite be said for southam , where there seems to be a blanket of grey .
old salt took this
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: unemployment up in the west midlands
text: the unemployment rate in the west midlands has risen by 6,000 , bringing the total number of unemployed people to 166,000 .
according to the office for national statistics ( ons ) , that equates to 5.9 % of the west midlands population being out of work .
nationally , uk unemployment fell by 64,000 to 1.49 million in the three months to may .
it meant the unemployment rate fell to its lowest since 1975 , at 4.5 % , the office for national statistics ( ons ) added .
author: Monica Rimmer
Journalist, BBC Online

documents.title: bowler out for the season after being struck at bear 's game
text: nottinghamshire bowler luke fletcher has been ruled out for the rest of the season after being hit in the head by the ball in a t20 blast match at edgbaston on saturday .
he was released from hospital on sunday after being struck by a straight drive from the bears ' sam hain and , after consultation with doctors , will not play again in 2017 .

documents.title: new hybrid london taxi unveiled
text: new hybrid london taxi unveiled

documents.title: watch : horse sculpture trigger gets new lease of life
text: trigger - coventry 's much-loved horse sculpture - is soon to return to his home after being repaired .
a friend of the late artist behind the piece has stepped in to rejuvenate it for free .
he will return to his original home on greyfriars green in the autumn .
author: Marian McNamee
Reporter, BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: mps order blood scandal inquiry
text: the conservative mp for stratford-upon-avon , nadhim zahawi says he wants to raise the experience of victims affected by the tainted blood scandal .
an inquiry will be held into the contaminated blood scandal that left at least 2,400 people dead , the prime minister has confirmed .
a coventry man whose father died after being given infected blood told bbc coventry and warwickshire he feels `` vindicated '' after the government 's decision yesterday to order the inquiry .
it 's the culmination of a long-running campaign by families of haemophiliacs and others who developed hepatitis c and h-i-v from imported blood products in the 1970s and 1980s .
jason evans from earlsdon was four years old when his dad died .

documents.title: safety inspection ruled cladding should be removed
text: letters to residents in hillman house state that the council believes the newly installed exterior on west orchards house on corporation street is n't appropriate .
in the letter , the wm housing group says a safety inspection was carried out by the fire service .
hillman house towers above the former allied carpet building .
the city council has since been advised that the external cladding needs to be removed .
residents have been invited to a briefing tonight where concerns can be discussed and questions answered .
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: cladding removed from student tower block
text: cladding is being removed from a former allied carpet building that is being renovated into student accommodation .
letters have gone out to residents in the adjoining hillman house stating that the council believes the cladding material is not fit to be used on a property over the height of 18m .
it said the newly installed exterior on west orchards house on corporation street is n't appropriate .
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: electric powered london taxis being built in coventry
text: a new electric and petrol-powered london taxi is being built in coventry .
the vehicle is expected to save drivers an average of £ 100 each week in fuel costs compared with the outgoing diesel model , according to its manufacturer .
it will hit the capital 's streets later this year .
an initial order for 225 vehicles has already been placed by dutch taxi operator rmc .

documents.title: site of former coventry school could be developed for housing
text: the site of a former special school could be developed for housing .
author: Coventry Telegraph

documents.title: sport headlines : clubs in friendly action
text: coventry city lost their pre-season match against french side valenciennes 3-2 in alicante .
a penalty converted by marc mcnulty and goal from teenager jordan ponticelli gave the blues a 2-1 lead before two late goals reversed the score .
nuneaton town lost 5-3 at home to peterborough .
former sky blues player billy daniels scored two of nuneaton 's goals with summer signing alex henshall getting the other .
leamington beat worcester city 3-1 , atherstone saw off burbage 3-0 and nuneaton griff beat coventry sphinx 4-2 .
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire Sport

documents.title: engineering company gets official opening
text: the engineering company tata technologies will open its new £ 20m european headquarters in leamington spa today .
around 200 jobs are being created at the european innovation and development centre .
they will mainly be for design engineers and programme managers in the automotive , aerospace and machinery sectors .

documents.title: watch : your 50-second weather forecast
text: it will be a fine day with plenty of sunny spells , these perhaps becoming more prolonged during the afternoon and evening .
with light winds it will feel much warmer than on tuesday - highs of 21c ( 70f ) .
author: Rich Davis
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: live updates for coventry and warwickshire
text: good morning from the coventry and warwickshire live team .
we 'll be bringing you all the latest news , sport , travel and weather for coventry and warwickshire between now and 18:00 .
if you 'd like to get in touch with the bbc local live team , you can do so by emailing us , tweeting @ twitterid or visiting our facebook page .

documents.title: our coverage across the day
text: we 're back from 08:00 on wednesday .

documents.title: blind couple to get honorary degrees for dedicated voluntary work
text: a blind couple who have been together since their school days are to receive honorary degrees from the university of warwick for decades of voluntary charity work helping local fellow blind and partially sighted people .
author: Leamington Observer

documents.title: man suffers head injuries in coleshill assault
text: a man was assaulted and left with injuries to his head and face after an incident in coleshill yesterday afternoon .
police say they were called to digby road at about 15:00 .
a 48-year-old coleshill man arrested on sus of assault has been released on police bail until next month .

documents.title: swansea to sign coventry 's harries
text: swansea to sign coventry 's harries

documents.title: weather : more rain to come in the west midlands
text: the rain should clear up overnight and it will be a lot dryer tomorrow , but there will be lots of cloud around .
author: Rich Davis
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: football : leamington v worcester city
text: worcester city take on leamington in a pre-season friendly tonight .
kick off at the phillips 66 community stadium is at 19:45 .

documents.title: region has more than 4,000 people with organ transplants
text: more than 4,000 people in the west midlands owe their lives to organ transplants .
nhs blood and transplant says the number of people on the organ donor register has increased by 27 % over the past five years .
it says despite the rise there is still a shortage of donors .
find out more on the nhs website .
author: BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: the secret of nymph
text: there are calls for a piece of public art to be put back on display in coventry .
the reclining water nymph , the naiad , was moved from its first home in the city centre after being vandalised in the 1990s .
she was then stolen from her next home in lady herbert 's garden and although police retrieved her , she was put in storage and has n't been seen in public since .

campaigner vincent hammersley says the `` important '' piece by city artist george wagstaff `` signifies the post war city of coventry cultural heritage '' and `` would grace any area of coventry '' - but is `` stuck in some old tractor shed '' .

the city council confirmed the piece was in storage , but said `` we do want to put it back out on public display and will continue to look for a safe and suitable location where it can be enjoyed again '' .

documents.title: wasps netball : bongiwe msomi leaves for australia
text: wasps netball will be without their south african international bongiwe msomi next season .
after helping wasps to the super league title , msomi is joining australian team adelaide thunderbirds .
a true winner on and off court and a real favourite among the squad and supporters !
# thanksbongi # onceawasp
@ bongiwemsomi2 had a huge impact on court and also off it with her amazing work with @ twitterid # thanksbongi # onceawasps
so going to miss u .
most definitely inspired our next generation .
will be keeping tabs on your future success .
bongi , you will be sadly missed .
good luck and keep being inspirational
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire Sport

documents.title: contaminated blood inquiry announced
text: an inquiry will be held into the contaminated blood scandal that left at least 2,400 people dead , the prime minister has confirmed .
the families of those who died will be consulted about what form the inquiry should take .
coventry man jason evans was just four years old when his father jonathan , a haemophiliac , died after being infected with hiv through contaminated factor viii treatment .
he recently discovered that in late 1984 his father had raised concerns with his doctors about factor viii .

documents.title: warwickshire trio sign extended deals
text: warwickshire trio sign extended deals

documents.title: 'peaceful demonstration ' held outside farm
text: a vegan charity held a 'peaceful demonstration ' outside a farm in oxhill , yesterday , monday .
author: Stratford Herald

documents.title: sky blues play pre-season friendly in spain
text: the sky blues face french side valenciennes in spain as part of their pre-season tour this evening .
their opponents play in the second tier of the french league .
the match kicks off at 18:00 .
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire Sport

documents.title: calls for inquiry after planning rules 'broken ' for coventry councillor 's home
text: coventry council is facing calls for an inquiry into how a councillor is living in a family home for which false information was used on a planning application - approved quietly by officers despite council rules .
author: Coventry Observer

documents.title: coventry 's london taxi company renamed
text: coventry-based london taxi company ( ltc ) says it 's to be renamed .
the announcement was made as the company revealed in london the final design of its electric vehicle .
the tx taxi will be on the streets of the capital later this year with a major international order for the netherlands also announced .
ltc will now be known as the london electric vehicle company - levc .

documents.title: police plea for help after assault in nuneaton nightclub car park
text: police say they need help to find thugs following an assault in the car park of a nuneaton nightclub which left several men injured .
author: Nuneaton News

documents.title: work to start on a45 junction expansion
text: work to improve a major city junction in order to ease congestion is set to start later this month , says the coventry and warwickshire local enterprise partnership ( cwlep ) .

the three-month scheme will see an extra lane added to the roundabout on the a45 at the leamington road and st martin 's road junction at finham , along with the addition of two pedestrian crossings .
the project is due to start on july 23 and was funded by the government 's local growth fund through the cwlep .

documents.title: boy 'hit in the face with brick ' during disturbance
text: a teenager was left with a suspected fractured cheekbone after he was hit , police believe , with a house brick during a disturbance near to the godiva festival on saturday .
officers were called to reports of disorder involving a gang of youths at about 22:00 in stoneleigh avenue , coventry .
the force said it was waiting to speak to the 15-year-old victim to get a clearer account of what happened .

documents.title: dirty used needle den found in nuneaton block of flats
text: a den of dirty , used needles was discovered by officers when they raided a flat in nuneaton .
author: Nuneaton News

documents.title: twelve caged cats dumped in field
text: the rspca has rescued 12 cats found abandoned in a makeshift cage .
they were discovered in a field in nuneaton .

documents.title: rail disruption between london and birmingham
text: trains between birmingham and london euston are delayed after a person was hit by a train .
network rail says services are either severely delayed or cancelled .
birmingham new street says : `` tickets are being accepted on chiltern services towards london departing from [ birmingham ] moor street station . ''
london midland and virgin trains services are affected , with services through warwickshire among those disrupted .
# vtnew due to emergency services dealing with an incident between watford jn and milton keynes , all lines are blocked .
updates to follow .
# vtupdate passengers with tickets via london euston , watford junction and milton keynes today , will be valid for travel tomorrow ( 12/07/17 )

documents.title: heavy congestion on m42 after lights failure
text: a traffic lights failure at curdworth island is causing heavy congestion on the m42 between j7 , m6 and j9 , m6 toll .
congestion is back to j5 , a452 for castle bromwich .
highways england says vehicles jumping red lights and blocking junctions has affected the sequencing in the area .
there are also reports from west midlands police of motorists getting out of their cars .
the # m42 j9 roundabout remains heavily congested .
vehicles disobeying red lights & blocking yellow box junctions has affected sequencing .
why on earth could n't the island junctions have been manned three hours earlier , it soon cleared once traffic officers arrived !
we have a limited number of traffic officers who deal with multiple incidents .
they would have got there as soon as they were able

@ twitterid made aware .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: people of coventry 'at the heart ' of uk city of culture bid , says theatre boss
text: the people of coventry would be the biggest winners if the city lands the uk city of culture 2021 prize , according to the executive director of the belgrade theatre .
author: Coventry Telegraph

documents.title: blood disaster : families search for the truth
text: jason evans says he is taking legal action against the government for its role in his father 's death .
more than 2,000 people - mostly haemophiliacs - have died after being infected with hiv and hepatitis c through blood treatments .
he 's now also backing calls for a hillsborough-style government inquiry .
panorama spoke to jason and other families affected earlier this year .

documents.title: 'emergency incident ' causing rail delays
text: rail services to and from london through leamington spa are being delayed due to an incident between bletchley and milton keynes central .
due to the emergency services dealing with an incident near the railway between bletchley and milton keynes central all lines are blocked .
how long will this blockages last please between # bletchley and # milton keyenes ?
we do n't have a time scale on that i 'm afraid
any idea how long the problem is ?
travelling this afternoon .
unfortunately not , no .
we have lots of ticket acceptance in place at the moment .
best to check closer to the time
so , can i use my advance ticket to go back to tamworth from milton keynes early ?
you will need to speak to the staff at milton keynes regarding your ticket chris

author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: marcus willis ' mum aces bullies who mocked son 's weight
text: the mum of wimbledon star marcus willis has aced trolls who criticised her son 's weight on social media .
author: Leamington Observer

documents.title: wimbledon 2017 : marcus willis and jay clarke knocked out of men 's doubles
text: warwick player and wimbledon favourite marcus willis said he and partner jay clarke `` did our very best '' against austria 's oliver marach and croatia 's mate pavic - but the opposition was `` just better on the day '' .
the pair were knocked out of the men 's doubles , losing in the last 16 .
willis , 26 , and clarke , 18 , had beaten 2016 champions pierre-hugues herbert and nicolas mahut in the second round , in what willis described as `` possibly one of the best days of my life '' .
there was a moment in the match , however , that was pretty painful for marach .

documents.title: family backs call for official inquiry into tainted blood scandal
text: the son of a coventry man who died after being treated with contaminated blood is supporting calls by leaders of opposition parties for a hillsborough-style inquiry .
jason evans was four years old when his father jonathan died after being infected with hiv .

a joint letter signed by six opposition leaders calls the scandal , which has claimed the lives of at least 2,400 people in britain , `` one of the worst peacetime disasters in our country 's history '' .
backing the call , mr evans said he wanted `` full transparency '' from the government and the `` truth put on record . ''

documents.title: video : how much rain can we expect today ?
text: a wet day is in store for many , with patchy rain growing steadily throughout the morning and into the afternoon .
it will feel cooler than yesterday , with highs of about 15c ( 59f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: good morning from the coventry newsroom
text: we 'll be bringing you all the latest news , sport , travel and weather for coventry and warwickshire between now and 18:00 .
if you 'd like to get in touch with the bbc local live team , you can do so by emailing us , tweeting @ twitterid or visiting our facebook page .
author: Vanessa Pearce
BBC Local Live

documents.title: our coverage across the day
text: live updates have now ended for coventry and warwickshire .
we 'll be back with the usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 tomorrow .

documents.title: sky blues train in spain
text: sky blues teenager chris camwell has flown out with the sky blues squad on their pre-season trip to spain .
the defender replaces ryan haynes who 's stayed at home for an assessment on the knee injury he suffered during the friendly win at sutton .
lee burge , jack grimmer , chris stokes and liam kelly , who all missed the match with slight strains , have travelled as has the young striker jordan ponticelli .
gallery : the # skyblues train in spain !
more : # pusb
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire Sport

documents.title: man dies in m45 crash
text: witnesses are being sought after a 55-year-old died in a crash on the m45 in warwickshire last thursday 6 july , police say .
the vehicle was travelling on the southbound side of the motorway near to junction one when it left the carriageway .
the man was taken to hospital but later died from his injuries .
his next-of-kin have been informed .

documents.title: video : watch the moment willis and clarke lose in three sets
text: after their epic victory over the defending champions and second seeds in their previous outing , the british duo marcus willis and jay clarke have bowed out of the doubles competition at the last-16 stage .
marcus `` willbomb '' willis was still smiling as he posed for selfies with supporters on court 14 .

documents.title: weather : heavy rain forecast
text: enjoy this gloomy , oppressive cloud while you can - tomorrow we 're getting heavy rain across the west midlands .
and it 's forecast to stay through the week .
author: Rich Davis
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: godiva trouble to be 'taken seriously ' , says council
text: reports of trouble at the godiva festival will be `` taken seriously '' and be considered during a `` full debrief '' says organiser , coventry council .
there were `` some elements of people who were n't there to enjoy the festival , '' said event director lee house .
`` with a crowd this size you will get people not there for the event , and get people who are a little difficult , '' she said .
`` we will be doing a full debrief with everyone concerned from st john ambulance , the security company and west midlands police . ''

documents.title: university 'in top 10 for employment '
text: students at coventry university are among the most likely to get jobs , according to research .
the survey by destination of leavers from higher education , suggests 97.1 % of the university 's graduates were employed or in further study within six months of leaving .
coventry came in eighth place , its highest ever ranking and putting it within the uk 's top 10 universities for employment rates .
vice-chancellor john latham said it was the `` university 's mission '' to prepare students for employment in a competitive market .

documents.title: stratford mp backs grenfell judge
text: stratford-upon-avon mp nadhim zahawi has backed the appointment of sir martin moore-bick to head up the inquiry into the grenfell tower fire describing criticism of him as `` the latest in a number of reckless attacks on our institutions '' .
the retired judge has faced calls to step down with kensington mp , labour 's emma dent coad , saying people were unlikely to co-operate without trust in sir martin .

writing for the conservative home blog , zahawi said it was `` frustrating to see politicians attack sir martin '' and that the government needed to `` find a way to remove as much emotion as possible from these difficult investigations into terrible subjects , and allow professionals to do their jobs '' .

documents.title: majority of bmw workers accept new pension scheme
text: unite the union said that over 80 % of staff across four uk bmw sites accepted the new pension deal , which will see planned strikes averted .
the union says that members were offered greater flexibility regarding the timing of transitional payments worth £ 22,000 over three years or £ 25,000 paid into the new pension programme .
workers will now move into one of the leading defined contribution pension schemes in the auto industry , it added .

documents.title: police investigate nuneaton assault and robbery
text: a woman was assaulted and robbed outside a takeaway on abbey green , nuneaton , last week , police say .
the victim , in her 20s , was approached by two men and a woman as she stood outside casa rica on abbey green shortly after 23:00 on monday 3 july .
after a brief argument , one of the men is reported to have hit the woman and taken her mobile phone and some cash .

documents.title: wimbledon 2017 : willis and clarke end winning run
text: marcus willis ' wimbledon adventure is over for this season .
the warwick boat club tennis professional has lost in the third round of the men 's doubles , along with his partner jay clarke .
the british pair had knocked out the reigning champions in the second round , but have gone down in three sets to the 16th seeds pavic and marach .
despite a great battle marcus willis & jay clarke 's # wimbledon is at an end as they go out of the men 's doubles .
willis ran out of gas bigtime , i hope chunk keeps his word and gets properly fit now
he 's off again
did you watch it ? he blew a gasket during set 2
shame hope to see you back in other tournaments soon .
well played lads

documents.title: bmw workers accept revised pension scheme
text: workers at car giant bmw have voted overwhelmingly to accept a revised offer over the closure of their pension scheme , ending the threat of more strikes , said the unite union .
union members were set to stage walkouts , including at hams hall in warwickshire , in a dispute over the closure of a final-salary pension scheme .

documents.title: county ins & outs 2017
text: county ins & outs 2017

documents.title: bedworth pub brawl leaves man in hospital
text: a brawl at a bedworth pub left a man with head and face injuries .
author: Coventry Telegraph

documents.title: in godiva festival
text: record crowds took to coventry 's war memorial park for the this year 's godiva festival , with performances from the stranglers , example & dj wire and the darkness across the weekend .
abdul khan , from the city council , said the festival had `` once again shown that it continues to grow each year '' .
thank you to all those who played their part , including sponsors , partners and staff , to ensure godiva festival continues to be the uk 's biggest free family music festival , '' he said .

laura mcmillan , coventry city of culture trust manager , said : bidding for uk city of culture , you have to show your city has the capacity to hold large scale events and with 179,000 visiting godiva this year , coventry has it covered . ''
you can find more and interviews with some of the artists on our facebook page .
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: rescue dog with mended heart to star in tv show
text: remember molly , the `` broken-hearted '' dog who had life-saving heart surgery ?
well she 's about to star in a tv show .
the five-year-old terrier , who was rescued by the rspca in coventry , was fitted with a pacemaker after vets discovered her heart was n't beating properly .
she 's now living with amanda hull , a foster carer in coventry , who called her , a sweetheart '' .
molly will star on the dog rescuers with alan davies on 11 july at 20:00 .

documents.title: council will not be testing cladding on warwickshire schools
text: warwickshire county council has decided that no fire safety testing is needed on materials currently used on buildings .
author: Stratford Observer

documents.title: twelve cats found in 'blazing heat '
text: twelve cats and kittens have been found dumped in a nuneaton hedge in an old chest of drawers , fashioned into a cage with chicken wire .
the rspca says the cats - some as young as 12 weeks-old - could easily have died after being abandoned with no food or water in direct sunlight in the `` blazing heat '' .
its officers were called to camp hill road , nuneaton on thursday 6 july , after the `` confused and nervous '' animals were found by a member of the public , it said .
the animals have been placed with a cattery until there 's space for them in a nearby rescue centre .
to abandon these lovely cats - some who are still very young and vulnerable - out in the middle of nowhere in this blazing heat is unthinkable .

documents.title: wimbledon 2017 : marcus willis and jay clarke begin next round
text: after saturday 's heroics , watch jay clarke and marcus willis ' next match in their wimbledon doubles adventure here :
their game against oliver marach and mate pavic has just started on court 14 .
queues for court 14 , where the marcus willis/jay clarke show continues against marach and pavic

documents.title: channel 4 tweet sees mayor accused of birmingham bias
text: west midlands mayor andy street has denied favouring birmingham over coventry after a deleted tweet attracted criticism .
author: Coventry Telegraph

documents.title: jobs for the girls : apprentice hoping to inspire others to engineering
text: a young female apprentice at aston martin in warwickshire is hoping to inspire the company to attract more women into the industry .
seventeen-year-old luca fremantle got her position after attending coventry 's wmg engineering academy .
author: Martin Winch
BBC Local Live

documents.title: hillfields community centre secures £ 75k towards refurbishment
text: a community centre in hillfields secured £ 75,000 towards its refurbishment - which includes an accessible kitchen .
author: Coventry Observer

documents.title: wimbledon 2017 : marcus willis and jay clarke stun defending doubles champions
text: britain 's marcus willis and jay clarke stunned defending men 's doubles champions pierre-hugues herbert and nicolas mahut at wimbledon .
the 26-year-old warwick player and 18-year-old clarke registered an entertaining 3-6 6-1 7-6 ( 7-3 ) 5-7 6-3 win over the french duo .
the british pair sent down 18 aces and hit 26 winners as they outmuscled their opponents .
willis became a wimbledon favourite last year after winning six matches to qualify before losing to seven-time champion roger federer on centre court in the second round .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: tattooist raises money for manchester terror attack victims
text: a tattooist in leamington has thanked kind-hearted residents for helping him raise money for victims of the manchester terror attack .
author: Leamington Observer

documents.title: youth arrested for carrying a knife at godiva
text: a teenager 's been charged with carrying a knife at the godiva festival , police say .
the 16-year-old was arrested on saturday evening after several reports of someone carrying a weapon .
he was charged with possessing a blade in a public place and bailed to appear before coventry youth court later this month .

documents.title: coventry nhs trust excels wellbeing charter standards
text: coventry and warwickshire partnership nhs trust has excelled standards in a national wellbeing charter - achieving `` excellent '' in four categories .
author: Coventry Observer

documents.title: police crackdown on drivers using mobile phones
text: about 1,000 people have been stopped for using their phones while driving over the past six months , police in west mercia and warwickshire say .
they are running a week-long crackdown , targeting drivers who use their phones .
earlier this year , the penalty for those caught using a hand-held mobile phone while driving doubled from £ 100 to £ 200 and from three to six points .

we are urging people to think about the consequences of their actions and ask themselves how they would feel if they caused a collision and injured , or killed , somebody else simply for the sake of making a call , reading a text message or checking social media . ''

documents.title: the darkness light up the godiva festival
text: coventry 's three-day godiva festival attracted record crowds , say the organisers .
around 179,000 attended the event at the city 's war memorial park this weekend .
rock band , the darkness headlined the festival , one of the uk 's biggest free music events .
we loved @ twitterid and it looks like you did too !
we believe in a thing called cov !
these guys rocked ! ! !
thank you godiva fest for a great afternoon .

they 're great live are n't they ?

documents.title: video : your 50-second weather forecast
text: after a bright and clear start it will become cloudier with the chance of some showers this afternoon and highs of 21c ( 70f ) .
author: Mel Coles
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: live updates for coventry and warwickshire
text: we 'll be bringing you all the latest news , sport , travel and weather for coventry and warwickshire between now and 18:00 .
if you 'd like to get in touch with the bbc local live team you can do so by emailing us , tweeting @ twitterid or visiting our facebook page .
author: Vanessa Pearce
BBC Local Live
